docs.title: 🚀 TekUp AI Assistant
docs.text:
Local AI-powered assistant for automating daily business tasks

Build your own intelligent assistant that integrates with your existing systems - no cloud APIs, no data leaving your laptop.

docs.title: ⚡ Quick Facts
docs.text:
• Local-First: All AI runs on your machine (RTX 5070 + Ollama)
  • Privacy: Zero data sent to cloud services
  • Smart: Uses Qwen2.5-Coder 14B, Llama 3.3 8B, and Mistral 7B
  • Integrated: Works with Billy.dk, RenOS, Google Workspace
  • Business Value: ~25,000 DKK/month in time savings

docs.title: 🎯 What Can It Do?
docs.text:
You: "Opret faktura til Michael Roach for 4 timer moving clean"
AI: ✅ Done in 15 seconds (vs 6-8 minutes manually)

You: "Hvad har jeg i dag?"
AI: 📅 Shows your schedule, access codes, notes - in 5 seconds

You: "Opret fakturaer for alle jobs fra sidste uge"
AI: ✅ 12 invoices created - 1 minute total

ROI: 115 minutes/day = 25,200 DKK/month saved

docs.title: 🏗️ TekUp AI Assistant - Architecture
docs.text: System overview og teknisk arkitektur for TekUp AI Assistant projektet.

docs.title: 🎯 High-Level Overview
docs.text:
graph TD
    A[User: Jonas] -->|Natural Language| B[Interface Layer]
    B --> C[Jan AI Desktop]
    B --> D[Cursor IDE]
    B --> E[VS Code Terminal]

    C -->|MCP Protocol| F[AI Engine Layer]
    D -->|MCP Protocol| F
    E -->|MCP Protocol| F

    F --> G[Ollama Server]
    G --> H[Qwen2.5-Coder 14B]
    G --> I[Llama 3.3 8B]
    G --> J[Mistral 7B]

    H -->|GPU Accelerated| K[MCP Integration Layer]
    I -->|GPU Accelerated| K
    J -->|GPU Accelerated| K

    K --> L[Tekup-Billy MCP]
    K --> M[RenOS MCP]
    K --> N[System MCP]
    K --> O[TekupVault MCP]

    L -->|HTTP API| P[Tekup-Billy Server]
    P -->|Billy.dk API| Q[Billy.dk]

    M -->|HTTP API| R[RenOS Backend]
    R -->|PostgreSQL| S[(Database)]
    R -->|API| T[Google Workspace]

    N -->|WMI/PowerShell| U[Windows System]

    O -->|pgvector| V[(Supabase)]

docs.title: 2. AI Engine Layer
docs.text: Purpose: Local AI model inference

docs.title: Ollama Server
docs.text:
• Version: 0.x.x
  • Protocol: HTTP REST API
  • Default Port: 11434
  • Endpoints:
  • POST /api/generate - Text generation
  • POST /api/chat - Chat completion
  • GET /api/tags - List models
  • POST /api/pull - Download models

Configuration: 

# Location: C:\Users\empir\.ollama\
# Models: C:\Users\empir\.ollama\models\
# Logs: Event Viewer → Windows Logs → Application

docs.title: Model Selection Strategy
docs.text:
Scenario Model Why Code writing/debugging Qwen2.5-Coder 14B Specialized for code, excellent TypeScript Business questions Llama 3.3 8B Good reasoning, balanced speed/quality Quick facts Mistral 7B Fast responses, lower resource usage Danish language Llama 3.3 8B Better multilingual support

Hardware Utilization: 

RTX 5070 (8GB VRAM):
├── Qwen 14B Q4: ~7GB VRAM, ~50% GPU utilization
├── Llama 8B Q5: ~5GB VRAM, ~40% GPU utilization
└── Mistral 7B Q4: ~3.5GB VRAM, ~30% GPU utilization

64GB System RAM:
├── OS + Apps: ~8GB
├── Ollama overhead: ~2GB
├── Model context: ~4-8GB (depending on conversation length)
└── Available: ~40GB (plenty of headroom)

docs.title: 3. MCP Integration Layer
docs.text: Purpose: Oversætter mellem AI og eksterne services

docs.title: Model Context Protocol (MCP)
docs.text:
What is MCP? - Open standard fra Anthropic - JSON-RPC baseret - AI-first design - Self-documenting tools

MCP Message Flow: 

User: "Opret faktura til Michael Roach, 4 timer"
    ↓
Jan AI parses intent
    ↓
Calls MCP: list_tools()
    → Sees: create_invoice, list_customers
    ↓
Calls MCP: call_tool(name="list_customers", args={query:"Michael Roach"})
    → Returns: {id: "c123", name: "Michael Roach"}
    ↓
Calls MCP: call_tool(name="create_invoice", args={customer_id:"c123", hours:4})
    → Returns: {invoice_id: "INV-2025-042", amount: 1396}
    ↓
Jan AI formats response
    ↓
User sees: "✅ Faktura INV-2025-042 oprettet: 1.396 DKK"

docs.title: Tekup-Billy (Existing)
docs.text:
Status: ✅ Already deployed URL: https://tekup-billy.onrender.com Version: v1.2.0

Architecture: 

TekUp AI Assistant
    ↓ HTTP POST
Tekup-Billy MCP Wrapper
    ↓ HTTP
Tekup-Billy Server (Node.js)
    ↓ Billy.dk API
Billy.dk Platform

Key Endpoints: - POST /billy/invoices - Create invoice - GET /billy/customers - List customers - GET /billy/products - List products - GET /billy/revenue - Get revenue data

Authentication: Bearer token (from env vars)

docs.title: RenOS Backend (Existing)
docs.text:
Status: ✅ Already deployed Tech Stack: Node.js + TypeScript + Prisma

Architecture: 

TekUp AI Assistant
    ↓ HTTP
RenOS MCP Wrapper
    ↓ REST API
RenOS Backend (Express)
    ↓ Prisma ORM
PostgreSQL Database

Key Endpoints: - GET /api/bookings - List/search bookings - POST /api/bookings - Create booking - GET /api/customers/:id - Get customer - GET /api/calendar - Get calendar events

Database Schema (Prisma): 

model Booking {
  id            String   @id @default(cuid())
  customerId    String
  serviceType   String
  startTime     DateTime
  durationHours Int
  status        String
  address       String?
  accessCode    String?
  notes         String?
  createdAt     DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt     DateTime @updatedAt

  customer Customer @relation(fields: [customerId], references: [id])
}

model Customer {
  id       String    @id @default(cuid())
  name     String
  email    String?
  phone    String?
  address  String?
  bookings Booking[]
}

docs.title: Google Workspace Integration
docs.text:
Via RenOS (Preferred): 

TekUp AI → RenOS Backend → Google Calendar API
                         → Gmail API

Direct (Alternative): 

TekUp AI → Google OAuth2 → Calendar/Gmail

Preferred approach: Via RenOS (authentication already handled)

docs.title: Windows Performance Monitoring
docs.text:
Data Sources: - WMI (Windows Management Instrumentation) - Performance Counters - Event Logs - Task Manager data

Metrics Collected: 

# Chrome RAM usage
Get-Process chrome | Measure-Object WorkingSet -Sum

# GPU utilization (NVIDIA)
nvidia-smi --query-gpu=utilization.gpu --format=csv

# Disk I/O
Get-Counter '\PhysicalDisk(_Total)\Disk Bytes/sec'

Alert Thresholds: - Chrome RAM >10GB → Suggest tab suspension - GPU usage >95% for 5+ min → Thermal warning - Disk usage >90% → Cleanup suggestion

docs.title: Example 1: Invoice Creation
docs.text:
sequenceDiagram
    participant U as User
    participant J as Jan AI
    participant O as Ollama
    participant M as Billy MCP
    participant T as Tekup-Billy
    participant B as Billy.dk

    U->>J: "Opret faktura til Michael, 4 timer"
    J->>O: Parse intent
    O->>J: {customer: "Michael", hours: 4}
    J->>M: list_customers(query: "Michael")
    M->>T: GET /billy/customers?search=Michael
    T->>B: API call
    B->>T: Customer data
    T->>M: {id: "c123", name: "Michael Roach"}
    M->>J: Customer found
    J->>M: create_invoice(customer_id: "c123", hours: 4)
    M->>T: POST /billy/invoices
    T->>B: Create invoice
    B->>T: Invoice created
    T->>M: {invoice_id: "INV-2025-042"}
    M->>J: Success
    J->>O: Format response
    O->>J: Danish response
    J->>U: "✅ Faktura INV-2025-042 oprettet: 1.396 DKK"

Timeline: - User input: 0s - AI parsing: 0-2s - MCP calls: 2-4s (2 API calls) - AI formatting: 4-5s - Total: ~5 seconds

docs.title: Example 2: Calendar Check
docs.text:
sequenceDiagram
    participant U as User
    participant J as Jan AI
    participant R as RenOS MCP
    participant B as RenOS Backend
    participant D as Database
    participant G as Google Calendar

    U->>J: "Hvad har jeg i morgen?"
    J->>R: search_bookings(date: "2025-01-16")
    R->>B: GET /api/bookings?date=2025-01-16
    B->>D: Prisma query
    D->>B: Booking records
    B->>G: Get calendar events
    G->>B: Calendar data
    B->>R: Combined results
    R->>J: Formatted booking list
    J->>U: "I morgen:\n- 08:00-10:00: Mette Nielsen..."

docs.title: Authentication Flow
docs.text:
User credentials → RenOS Backend
                 → Stored in .env (encrypted)
                 → Never exposed to AI

Billy.dk API key → Tekup-Billy .env
                 → Not in version control
                 → Rotated quarterly

Google OAuth2 → RenOS handles
              → Refresh tokens managed
              → Scoped permissions only

docs.title: Data Privacy
docs.text:
Local-First Design: - ✅ All AI models run locally (no cloud API calls) - ✅ Customer data stays in your database - ✅ Conversations stored locally only - ✅ No telemetry to external services

GDPR Compliance: - Right to erasure: Delete conversation history - Data minimization: Only fetch needed data - Purpose limitation: AI only accesses data for specified tasks - Audit trail: All MCP calls logged

docs.title: Latency Breakdown
docs.text: Component Latency Notes User input → Jan AI <50ms Local UI Jan AI → Ollama 50-100ms HTTP localhost Ollama inference 2-5s GPU dependent MCP call 200-500ms Network + API Total (simple query) 3-6s Acceptable Total (multi-API) 5-10s Multiple MCP calls

docs.title: Scalability
docs.text:
Current Setup: - Single user (Jonas) - Local execution only - No concurrent requests

Future (if needed): - Multi-user: Deploy Ollama on server - Concurrent: Queue system for requests - Caching: Store common MCP responses

docs.title: 🎯 Hvad er implementeret?
docs.text: En Python-baseret MCP (Model Context Protocol) server der giver AI-assistenten evnen til at hente og analysere webindhold direkte, inklusiv JavaScript-renderet indhold fra delte Claude-samtaler.

docs.title: ✅ Installation Status
docs.text:
Alle nødvendige komponenter er installeret og testet:

  • ✅ Python 3.13.7 - Kørende og verificeret
  • ✅ Node.js v24.8.0 - Installeret (bonus, ikke påkrævet)
  • ✅ MCP Python pakke - Installeret
  • ✅ Playwright - Installeret med Chromium browser
  • ✅ Requests & BeautifulSoup4 - Installeret
  • ✅ MCP Web Scraper - Oprettet og testet
  • ✅ Test Suite - Alle tests bestået ✅

docs.title: 🚀 Næste skridt: Aktivér MCP-serveren i Cursor
Metode 1: Via Cursor Settings (Anbefalet)
docs.text:
1. Åbn Cursor Settings

  2. Tryk Ctrl+, eller File > Preferences > Settings

  3. Find MCP Settings

  4. Søg efter "MCP" i søgefeltet

  5. Gå til Features > MCP

  6. Tilføj MCP Server

  7. Klik på "+ Add New MCP Server"

  8. Indtast:

    • Navn: web-scraper
    • Type: stdio
    • Command: python
    • Args: C:\Users\empir\tekup-ai-assistant\scripts\mcp_web_scraper.py

  9. Gem og Genstart

  10. Gem ændringerne
  11. Genstart Cursor fuldstændigt (luk og åbn)

docs.title: Metode 2: Via konfigurationsfil
docs.text:
Hvis Cursor understøtter at læse MCP-konfiguration fra fil:

{
  "mcpServers": {
    "web-scraper": {
      "command": "python",
      "args": ["C:\\Users\\empir\\tekup-ai-assistant\\scripts\\mcp_web_scraper.py"]
    }
  }
}

Konfigurationsfilen findes allerede her: configs/claude-desktop/mcp_config.json

docs.title: 🔧 Tilgængelige værktøjer
docs.text: Når MCP-serveren er aktiveret, har AI-assistenten adgang til:

docs.title: 1. fetch_url (Anbefalet til dynamisk indhold)
docs.text:
Bruger Playwright med Chromium til at hente indhold, inklusiv JavaScript-renderet sider.

Eksempel brug: 

Brug fetch_url værktøjet til at hente indhold fra:
https://claude.ai/share/ae42cf6f-0409-4ff7-a1c1-1d78e3fb0d6a

Parametre: - url (påkrævet): URL'en der skal hentes - wait_for (valgfri): CSS selector at vente på før scraping

docs.title: 2. fetch_url_simple (Hurtigere til statiske sider)
docs.text:
Bruger simple HTTP requests til statiske HTML-sider.

Eksempel brug: 

Brug fetch_url_simple værktøjet til at hente: https://example.com

docs.title: Test MCP-serveren direkte:
docs.text:
python scripts/test_mcp_scraper.py

Du skulle se: 

✅ Simple HTTP: PASSED
✅ Playwright: PASSED
🎉 Alle tests bestået!

docs.title: Test i Cursor (efter genstart):
docs.text:
Åbn en ny chat og spørg: 

Hvilke MCP-værktøjer har du adgang til?

Du skulle se fetch_url og fetch_url_simple i listen.

docs.title: Eksempel 1: Hent delt Claude-samtale
docs.text:
Brug fetch_url til at hente indholdet fra denne delte Claude-samtale:
https://claude.ai/share/ae42cf6f-0409-4ff7-a1c1-1d78e3fb0d6a

Analysér derefter indholdet og giv mig en rapport.

docs.title: Eksempel 2: Hent og analysér enhver webside
docs.text: Hent indholdet fra https://example.com og giv mig en opsummering.

docs.title: Problem: MCP-server vises ikke i Cursor
docs.text: Løsning: 1. Bekræft at Python er i PATH: python --version 2. Kontroller den fulde sti er korrekt i konfigurationen 3. Genstart Cursor fuldstændigt 4. Tjek Cursor's output/developer tools for fejl

docs.title: Problem: Playwright timeout fejl
docs.text: Løsning: 1. Kontroller internetforbindelse 2. Nogle sider tager længere tid - timeout kan øges i mcp_web_scraper.py 3. Prøv fetch_url_simple som alternativ for statiske sider

docs.title: Problem: UnicodeEncodeError
docs.text: Løsning: - Dette er allerede fikset i test-scriptet - Hvis det sker i MCP-serveren, lad mig vide

docs.title: 🎉 Hvad kan du nu gøre?
docs.text:
Med MCP Web Scraper aktiveret kan AI-assistenten:

  1. ✅ Hente indhold fra delte Claude-samtaler
  2. ✅ Analysere dynamisk JavaScript-renderet indhold
  3. ✅ Scrape enhver offentlig tilgængelig webside
  4. ✅ Automatisk analysere og rapportere om webindhold
  5. ✅ Integrere web-data i dit TekUp AI Assistant workflow

docs.title: 📞 Support
docs.text:
Hvis du støder på problemer:

  1. Kør test-scriptet: python scripts/test_mcp_scraper.py
  2. Tjek logs i Cursor's developer tools
  3. Verificér alle pakker er installeret: pip list | findstr "mcp playwright requests"

docs.title: 🔄 Næste opgave
docs.text:
Nu hvor MCP-serveren er sat op, er næste skridt:

  1. Tilføj MCP-serveren i Cursor Settings (følg Metode 1 ovenfor)
  2. Genstart Cursor
  3. Test at værktøjerne er tilgængelige
  4. Hent og analysér det delte Claude-link

Når du har aktiveret MCP-serveren i Cursor, kan du bede AI-assistenten om at hente og analysere indholdet fra: 

https://claude.ai/share/ae42cf6f-0409-4ff7-a1c1-1d78e3fb0d6a

docs.title: 🚀 TekUp AI Assistant - Setup Guide
docs.text: Komplet installationsguide til opsætning af din lokale AI-assistent.

docs.title: ⚙️ Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Windows 10/11 (x64)
  • 16GB+ RAM (32GB+ recommended) - Du har: 64GB ✅
  • GPU: NVIDIA RTX series (optional but recommended) - Du har: RTX 5070 ✅
  • Disk Space: ~50GB free (for models)
  • Internet: For initial download only

docs.title: Step 1: Download Ollama
docs.text:
Install via winget (anbefalet): 

winget install Ollama.Ollama

Eller download manuelt: - Visit: https://ollama.com/download/windows - Download Windows installer - Kør installer og følg instruktioner

docs.title: Step 2: Verify Installation
docs.text:
# Check version
ollama --version

# Should output: ollama version is 0.x.x

docs.title: Step 3: Download AI Models
docs.text:
Download Qwen2.5-Coder (for coding assistance): 

ollama pull qwen2.5-coder:14b-instruct-q4_K_M
⏱️ Download size: ~8GB, takes 5-15 minutes depending on connection

Download Llama 3.3 (for general tasks): 

ollama pull llama3.3:8b-instruct-q5_K_M
⏱️ Download size: ~6GB

Download Mistral (for fast responses): 

ollama pull mistral:7b-instruct-q4_K_M
⏱️ Download size: ~4GB

docs.title: Step 4: Test Ollama
docs.text:
# List downloaded models
ollama list

# Start interactive chat with Qwen
ollama run qwen2.5-coder:14b-instruct-q4_K_M

# Type a test message:
# "Write a TypeScript function to format Danish currency"

# Exit: Ctrl+D or type /bye

Expected output: 

function formatDanishCurrency(amount: number): string {
  return new Intl.NumberFormat('da-DK', {
    style: 'currency',
    currency: 'DKK'
  }).format(amount);
}

docs.title: Step 1: Download Jan AI
docs.text:
Install via winget (anbefalet): 

winget install Jan.Jan

Eller download manuelt: - Visit: https://jan.ai/download - Download Windows installer - Kør installer

docs.title: Step 2: Launch Jan AI
docs.text:
1. Open Jan AI from Start Menu
  2. Wait for initial setup to complete

docs.title: Step 3: Configure Ollama Connection
docs.text:
1. Click Settings (⚙️ icon i venstre sidebar)
  2. Go to Model Sources
  3. Click + Add Model Source
  4. Select Ollama from dropdown
  5. URL: http://localhost:11434
  6. Click Connect

✅ Du skulle se "Connected successfully" hvis Ollama kører

docs.title: Step 4: Configure Default Model
docs.text:
1. Go to Chat tab
  2. Click Select Model (øverst)
  3. Under "Ollama Models" vælg qwen2.5-coder:14b-instruct-q4_K_M
  4. Click Use Model

docs.title: Step 5: Test Chat
docs.text:
Type i chat: 

Explain TypeScript interfaces in simple terms

Expected: - Response inden for 5-10 sekunder - Kvalitets svar om TypeScript - GPU utilization (check Task Manager → Performance → GPU)

docs.title: 📋 Phase 2.5: Install Open WebUI (Docker-based Alternative) (10 minutes)
docs.text: Alternative til Jan AI: Hvis du foretrækker en moderne web-baseret interface med fuld CLI-kontrol

docs.title: Prerequisites:
docs.text:
• Docker Desktop må være installeret (check: docker --version)
  • Ollama kørende i baggrund

docs.title: Step 1: Automated Setup (Anbefalet)
docs.text:
./scripts/setup-open-webui.ps1

Dette script vil: - ✅ Verificere Docker er kørende - ✅ Hente Open WebUI Docker image - ✅ Starte container på port 3000 - ✅ Vente på health check - ✅ Vise næste steps

docs.title: Step 2: Manual Setup (Alternative)
docs.text:
Hvis du foretrækker manuel kontrol:

# Start Docker Desktop hvis det ikke kører
Start-Process "C:\Program Files\Docker\Docker\Docker Desktop.exe"

# Vent 10 sekunder
Start-Sleep -Seconds 10

# Start Open WebUI container
docker run -d -p 3000:8080 `
  --add-host=host.docker.internal:host-gateway `
  --name open-webui `
  ghcr.io/open-webui/open-webui:latest

docs.title: Step 3: Monitor Stack Status
docs.text:
# Monitor alle tjenester (Ollama, Open WebUI, Docker)
./scripts/monitor-stack.ps1

Expected output: 

TekUp Stack Monitor

Ollama Server:
   [OK] Ollama is running

Open WebUI:
   [OK] Open WebUI is running

Docker Container:
   [OK] Container is running
   open-webui Up X minutes

Done

docs.title: Step 4: Access Open WebUI
docs.text:
1. Open browser: http://localhost:3000
  2. Opret admin account (første bruger)
  3. Gå til Settings → Models
  4. Add connection: http://host.docker.internal:11434
  5. Select dine Ollama modeller:
  6. qwen2.5-coder:14b-instruct-q4_K_M
  7. llama3.3:8b-instruct-q5_K_M
  8. mistral:7b-instruct-q4_K_M

docs.title: Step 5: Test Chat
docs.text:
Send besked i Open WebUI: 

Write a TypeScript function to calculate invoice total with tax

Expected: Response inden for 5-10 sekunder

docs.title: Check Status
docs.text: ./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action status

docs.title: View Real-time Logs
docs.text: ./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action logs

docs.title: Stop Container
docs.text: ./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action stop

docs.title: Start Container
docs.text: ./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action start

docs.title: Health Check
docs.text: ./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action health

docs.title: 📚 Full CLI Control Guide
docs.text: Se komplet guide med alle commands: - CLI Control Guide - Alle Docker/Ollama/Open WebUI commands - Docker Troubleshooting - Fælles problemer og løsninger

docs.title: Step 1: Understand Current Setup
docs.text: Du har allerede: - Tekup-Billy deployed på: https://tekup-billy.onrender.com - API endpoints til Billy.dk (invoices, customers, products)

docs.title: Step 2: Find Jan AI Config Location
docs.text:
Jan AI config fil er typisk her: 

C:\Users\empir\AppData\Roaming\jan\extensions\

eller

C:\Users\empir\.jan\extensions\

docs.title: Step 3: Create MCP Config
docs.text:
Opret fil: mcp-config.json i extensions folder

Content (start simple): 

{
  "mcpServers": {
    "tekup-billy": {
      "command": "node",
      "args": [
        "-e",
        "const http = require('http'); const fetch = require('node-fetch'); const server = http.createServer(async (req, res) => { if (req.method === 'POST' && req.url === '/mcp/tools/list') { res.writeHead(200, {'Content-Type': 'application/json'}); res.end(JSON.stringify({tools: [{name: 'create_invoice', description: 'Create invoice in Billy.dk', inputSchema: {type: 'object', properties: {customer_id: {type: 'string'}, hours: {type: 'number'}, description: {type: 'string'}}, required: ['customer_id', 'hours']}}]})); } else if (req.method === 'POST' && req.url === '/mcp/tools/call') { let body = ''; req.on('data', chunk => body += chunk); req.on('end', async () => { const data = JSON.parse(body); if (data.name === 'create_invoice') { const result = await fetch('https://tekup-billy.onrender.com/billy/invoices', { method: 'POST', headers: {'Content-Type': 'application/json'}, body: JSON.stringify(data.arguments) }); const json = await result.json(); res.writeHead(200, {'Content-Type': 'application/json'}); res.end(JSON.stringify(json)); } }); } }); server.listen(3001); console.log('Billy MCP running on port 3001');"
      ]
    }
  }
}

Note: Dette er en simpel inline MCP server. I Phase 2 bygger vi en proper server.

docs.title: Step 4: Restart Jan AI
docs.text:
1. Close Jan AI helt
  2. Åbn igen
  3. Check at MCP server starter (se console/logs)

docs.title: Step 5: Test Billy Integration (Manual First)
docs.text:
Test API direkte først: 

# Test Tekup-Billy API
curl https://tekup-billy.onrender.com/billy/customers

# Should return customer list

docs.title: Checklist:
docs.text:
• [ ] Ollama running: ollama list viser 3 modeller
  • [ ] Jan AI connected: Jan AI kan se Ollama models
  • [ ] Chat works: Kan få responses fra AI
  • [ ] GPU utilized: Task Manager viser GPU usage når AI svarer
  • [ ] Tekup-Billy accessible: API svarer på requests

docs.title: Test Commands i Jan AI:
docs.text:
Test 1: General query 

What is TypeScript?

Test 2: Coding assistance 

Write a React component for a booking form with fields:
- Customer name
- Date picker
- Service type dropdown (Basic, Deep, Move-out)
- Duration (2-8 hours)

Test 3: Danish response 

Forklar hvad React hooks er på dansk

docs.title: Ollama won't start
docs.text:
# Check if already running
tasklist | findstr ollama

# Kill and restart
taskkill /F /IM ollama.exe
ollama serve

docs.title: Model download fails

# Check disk space
Get-PSDrive C | Select-Object Used,Free

docs.title: Jan AI can't connect to Ollama
docs.text:
1. Ensure Ollama is running: 

    ollama serve

  2. Check port 11434 is free:

    Should show: LISTENING on port 11434

docs.title: GPU not being used

1. Check NVIDIA drivers:

  2. Verify Ollama sees GPU: 

    ollama run qwen2.5-coder:14b-instruct-q4_K_M "test"
    Should show GPU usage in Task Manager

  3. If CPU only: Models will work but slower (10-30 sek vs 3-5 sek)

docs.title: Jan AI MCP server not starting

1. Check Node.js installed: 

    node --version
    Should show v24.8.0 or similar

  2. Check MCP config syntax: Validate JSON 

    Get-Content "C:\Users\empir\.jan\extensions\mcp-config.json" | ConvertFrom-Json

  3. Check Jan AI logs:

  4. Open Jan AI
  5. Settings → Advanced → Show Logs
  6. Look for MCP errors

docs.title: 🔧 TekUp AI Assistant - Troubleshooting
docs.text: Common issues og solutions for TekUp AI Assistant setup.

docs.title: 📋 Table of Contents
docs.text:
1. Ollama Issues
  2. Jan AI Issues
  3. MCP Integration Issues
  4. Performance Issues
  5. Billy.dk Integration
  6. RenOS Integration

docs.title: Issue: Ollama won't start
docs.text:
Symptoms: - ollama command not found - "Failed to connect to Ollama" in Jan AI - Port 11434 not listening

Solutions:

# 1. Check if Ollama is installed
ollama --version

# If not found, reinstall:
winget install Ollama.Ollama

# 2. Check if service is running
tasklist | findstr ollama

# If not running, start it:
ollama serve

# 3. Check port 11434
netstat -an | findstr 11434
# Should show: LISTENING on 11434

# 4. Restart Ollama service
taskkill /F /IM ollama.exe
Start-Sleep -Seconds 2
ollama serve

Prevention: - Add Ollama to startup programs - Create shortcut: ollama serve in Startup folder

docs.title: Issue: Model download fails
docs.text:
Symptoms: - Download stops at X% - "Network error" during pull - Disk space error

Solutions:

# 1. Check disk space (need ~20GB free)
Get-PSDrive C | Select-Object Used,Free

# 2. Check internet connection
Test-NetConnection github.com -Port 443

# 3. Retry with verbose logging
ollama pull qwen2.5-coder:14b-instruct-q4_K_M --verbose

# 4. If still fails, try smaller model first
ollama pull mistral:7b-instruct-q4_K_M

# 5. Clear Ollama cache
Remove-Item -Recurse -Force $env:USERPROFILE\.ollama\models\blobs\sha256-incomplete*

# 6. Retry download
ollama pull qwen2.5-coder:14b-instruct-q4_K_M

docs.title: Issue: Model runs very slowly (30+ seconds)
docs.text:
Symptoms: - GPU not being used (check Task Manager) - CPU at 100% - Long response times

Diagnosis:

# Check if NVIDIA GPU is detected
nvidia-smi

# If error, reinstall NVIDIA drivers
# Download from: https://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx

Solutions:

  1. Update NVIDIA drivers:
  2. Download latest GeForce driver

  3. Install and restart

  4. Verify GPU support: 

    # Ollama should show GPU
ollama run qwen2.5-coder:14b-instruct-q4_K_M "test"
# Check Task Manager → Performance → GPU → CUDA

  5. If GPU still not used:

  6. Reinstall Ollama (might have installed CPU-only version)
  7. Check CUDA toolkit: nvcc --version

docs.title: Issue: Jan AI won't connect to Ollama
docs.text:
Symptoms: - "Failed to connect" error - Ollama models not showing in Jan AI - Timeout errors

Solutions:

  1. Verify Ollama is running: 

    # Should return HTTP 200
curl http://localhost:11434/api/tags

  2. Check Jan AI settings:

  3. Settings → Model Sources
  4. Ensure URL is exactly: http://localhost:11434

  5. Click "Test Connection" → should show green checkmark

  6. Firewall issues: 

    # Check if Windows Firewall is blocking
Get-NetFirewallRule | Where-Object {$_.DisplayName -like "*Ollama*"}

# If blocked, create rule:
New-NetFirewallRule -DisplayName "Ollama" -Direction Inbound -Action Allow -Protocol TCP -LocalPort 11434

  7. Restart both applications: 

    # Kill both
taskkill /F /IM ollama.exe
taskkill /F /IM jan.exe

# Start Ollama first
Start-Process ollama -ArgumentList "serve"

# Wait 5 seconds
Start-Sleep -Seconds 5

# Start Jan AI
Start-Process jan

docs.title: Issue: Jan AI crashes or freezes
docs.text:
Symptoms: - App becomes unresponsive - White screen - Memory error

Solutions:

  1. Clear Jan AI cache: 

    # Close Jan AI first
Remove-Item -Recurse -Force "$env:APPDATA\jan\Cache"
Remove-Item -Recurse -Force "$env:APPDATA\jan\GPUCache"

  2. Reset Jan AI settings: 

    # Backup first
Copy-Item "$env:APPDATA\jan" "$env:APPDATA\jan_backup" -Recurse

# Remove settings
Remove-Item "$env:APPDATA\jan\settings.json"

  3. Reinstall Jan AI: 

    winget uninstall Jan.Jan
winget install Jan.Jan

docs.title: Issue: Billy MCP not responding
docs.text:
Symptoms: - "Tool not found" error - Invoice creation fails - Timeout errors

Diagnosis:

# 1. Test Tekup-Billy API directly
curl https://tekup-billy.onrender.com/health

# 2. Check if MCP config exists
Test-Path "$env:APPDATA\jan\extensions\mcp-config.json"

# 3. Validate JSON syntax
Get-Content "$env:APPDATA\jan\extensions\mcp-config.json" | ConvertFrom-Json

Solutions:

  1. Verify Tekup-Billy is running:
  2. Visit: https://tekup-billy.onrender.com

  3. Should show API status page

  4. Check MCP config: 

    {
  "mcpServers": {
    "tekup-billy": {
      "url": "https://tekup-billy.onrender.com",
      "timeout": 30000
    }
  }
}

  5. Check API key (if required):

  6. Ensure .env has BILLY_API_KEY

  7. Verify key is valid

  8. Restart Jan AI to reload MCP config

docs.title: Issue: MCP tools not showing in Jan AI
docs.text:
Symptoms: - Can't see create_invoice tool - AI doesn't know about Billy integration

Solutions:

  1. Verify MCP config location: 

    # Jan AI looks here:
$env:APPDATA\jan\extensions\mcp-config.json

# Or here:
$env:USERPROFILE\.jan\extensions\mcp-config.json

# Create if missing:
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path "$env:APPDATA\jan\extensions"

  2. Check Jan AI logs:

  3. Jan AI → Settings → Advanced → Show Logs

  4. Look for "MCP" errors

  5. Minimal test config: 

    {
  "mcpServers": {
    "test": {
      "command": "node",
      "args": ["-e", "console.log('MCP test')"]
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Issue: High RAM usage (>40GB)
docs.text:
Symptoms: - System slows down - Ollama using 20GB+ RAM - Chrome crashes

Solutions:

  1. Check what's using RAM: 

    Get-Process | Sort-Object WorkingSet -Descending | Select-Object -First 10 ProcessName,@{Name="RAM(MB)";Expression={[math]::Round($_.WorkingSet/1MB,2)}}

  2. Limit Ollama context:

  3. Shorter conversations use less RAM

  4. Restart Ollama periodically

  5. Close unused apps: 

    # Kill Chrome if not needed
taskkill /F /IM chrome.exe

  6. Use smaller model temporarily: 

    # Switch to Mistral 7B (uses ~4GB vs 8GB)
ollama run mistral:7b-instruct-q4_K_M

docs.title: Issue: Slow AI responses (>30 seconds)
docs.text:
Symptoms: - Every response takes 30+ seconds - GPU shows 0% usage - CPU at 100%

Root causes & fixes:

  1. GPU not being used:
  2. Update NVIDIA drivers
  3. Reinstall Ollama

  4. Check nvidia-smi shows GPU

  5. Model too large:

  6. Qwen 14B might be too big if RAM is low

  7. Try Llama 8B instead: 

    ollama run llama3.3:8b-instruct-q5_K_M

  8. Thermal throttling:

  9. Check GPU temperature: nvidia-smi
  10. If >80°C, improve cooling

  11. Reduce GPU clock if needed

  12. Background processes: 

    # Find CPU hogs
Get-Process | Sort-Object CPU -Descending | Select-Object -First 10

docs.title: Issue: "Customer not found" errors
docs.text:
Symptoms: - AI can't find customer by name - list_customers returns empty

Solutions:

  1. Test API manually: 

    curl "https://tekup-billy.onrender.com/billy/customers?search=Michael"

  2. Check customer name spelling:

  3. AI needs exact match

  4. Try: "Michael Roach" not "Michael R."

  5. Update customer search logic:

  6. Fuzzy matching might be needed
  7. See tekup-billy repo for improvements

docs.title: Issue: Invoice creation fails
docs.text:
Symptoms: - "Unknown error" when creating invoice - 500 error from Billy API - Missing required fields

Diagnosis:

# Test invoice creation manually
$body = @{
    contactId = "test-customer-id"
    lines = @(
        @{
            description = "Test service"
            quantity = 2
            unitPrice = 349
        }
    )
} | ConvertTo-Json

curl -X POST "https://tekup-billy.onrender.com/billy/invoices" `
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" `
     -d $body

Solutions:

  1. Check Billy.dk API status:
  2. Visit Billy.dk

  3. Check for maintenance

  4. Verify API credentials:

  5. Check .env in Tekup-Billy

  6. Regenerate API key if expired

  7. Check invoice data:

  8. Customer ID must exist
  9. Quantity must be >0
  10. Unit price must be >0

docs.title: Issue: Bookings not syncing
docs.text:
Symptoms: - AI shows old bookings - Calendar out of date - Missing recent entries

Solutions:

  1. Check RenOS API: 

    curl "https://renos-backend.onrender.com/api/bookings"

  2. Clear cache (if implemented):

  3. Restart MCP server

  4. Force refresh in Jan AI

  5. Check database connection:

  6. RenOS backend logs
  7. Supabase/PostgreSQL status

docs.title: Issue: Access codes missing
docs.text:
Symptoms: - AI shows booking without access code - "null" or "-" for code

Solutions:

  1. Check database:
  2. Verify accessCode field exists

  3. Check if it's populated

  4. Update query:

  5. Ensure MCP fetches all fields

  6. Include accessCode in SELECT

  7. Manual entry:

  8. Update RenOS booking with code
  9. Refresh AI query

docs.title: 🆘 Emergency Reset
docs.text:
If everything is broken:

# 1. Stop all services
taskkill /F /IM ollama.exe
taskkill /F /IM jan.exe
taskkill /F /IM node.exe

# 2. Clear caches
Remove-Item -Recurse -Force "$env:APPDATA\jan\Cache"
Remove-Item -Recurse -Force "$env:USERPROFILE\.ollama\models\blobs\sha256-incomplete*"

# 3. Restart Ollama
Start-Process ollama -ArgumentList "serve"
Start-Sleep -Seconds 5

# 4. Test Ollama
curl http://localhost:11434/api/tags

# 5. Start Jan AI
Start-Process jan

# 6. Reconfigure from scratch
# Follow SETUP.md Phase 1-3 again

docs.title: Check Logs
docs.text:
Ollama logs: 

# Windows Event Viewer
eventvwr
# → Windows Logs → Application → Source: Ollama

Jan AI logs: - Jan AI → Settings → Advanced → Show Logs

MCP logs: - Console output where MCP server runs

docs.title: Collect Debug Info
docs.text:
# System info
systeminfo | findstr /C:"OS Name" /C:"Total Physical Memory"

# GPU info
nvidia-smi

# Ollama info
ollama list
ollama --version

# Network connectivity
Test-NetConnection github.com -Port 443
Test-NetConnection localhost -Port 11434

# Save to file
systeminfo > debug-info.txt
nvidia-smi >> debug-info.txt
ollama list >> debug-info.txt

docs.title: Report Issue
docs.text:
Include: 1. Error message (exact text) 2. Steps to reproduce 3. System info (from above) 4. Screenshots (if UI issue) 5. Logs (relevant sections)

Where to report: - GitHub Issues: tekup-ai-assistant - Or check chat.md for previous discussions

docs.title: 🔄 TekUp AI Assistant - Workflows
docs.text: Praktiske eksempler på hvordan du bruger AI-assistenten til daglige opgaver.

docs.title: 📋 Table of Contents
docs.text:
1. Invoice Creation
  2. Calendar Management
  3. Code Debugging
  4. Customer Follow-up
  5. Morning Routine

docs.title: Scenario: Create Invoice for Completed Job
docs.text:
Current workflow (manual): 1. Open Billy.dk in browser (30 sek) 2. Find customer in dropdown (30 sek) 3. Enter invoice lines (3-5 min) 4. Calculate total (1 min) 5. Save and send (30 sek) Total: 6-8 minutes

With AI Assistant:

You: "Opret faktura til Michael Roach for 4 timer moving clean fra i går"

AI: 
[Checking customer database...]
[Found: Michael Roach, customer ID: c123]
[Calculating: 4 hours × 349 DKK = 1.396 DKK]
[Creating invoice in Billy.dk...]

✅ Faktura INV-2025-042 oprettet:
- Kunde: Michael Roach
- Service: Moving clean (flytterengøring)
- Timer: 4
- Beløb: 1.396 DKK (inkl. moms)
- Status: Sendt til kunde via email

Faktura link: https://billy.dk/invoices/INV-2025-042

Time: 15-20 seconds Savings: 7 minutes per invoice

docs.title: Variations
docs.text:
Multiple line items: 

You: "Opret faktura til Kunde XYZ:
- 3 timer basic cleaning
- 1 time deep cleaning af køkken
- Tilkørsel 50 km"

AI: [Processes each line]
✅ Faktura oprettet: 1.896 DKK

Recurring invoice: 

You: "Opret månedlig faktura til Kunde ABC som sidst"

AI: [Finds previous invoice]
[Copies line items]
✅ Faktura oprettet baseret på sidste måneds service

Bulk invoicing: 

You: "Opret fakturaer for alle jobs fra sidste uge"

AI: [Queries RenOS for completed bookings]
[Creates 12 invoices]
✅ 12 fakturaer oprettet:
- Total: 18.542 DKK
- Sendt til kunder

docs.title: Scenario: Check Today's Schedule
docs.text:
Current workflow: 1. Open Google Calendar (15 sek) 2. Check RenOS booking system (30 sek) 3. Cross-reference (1 min) 4. Find addresses/codes manually (2 min) Total: 4-5 minutes

With AI Assistant:

You: "Hvad har jeg i dag?"

AI:
📅 I DAG - Onsdag 15. januar 2025

08:00-10:00 🏠 Mette Nielsen
- Adresse: Sødalvej 4, 8000 Aarhus C
- Service: Basic cleaning (2 timer)
- Nøglekode: 1234
- Note: Hund i hjemmet

10:30-12:00 🏠 Jørn Haagensen  
- Adresse: Sølykken 16, 1. th, 8200 Aarhus N
- Service: Deep cleaning (2 timer)
- Nøglekode: 1745
- Note: TIL AFKLARING - Kontakt ang. ekstra rum

14:00-16:00 🏠 Eoin Moving Clean
- Adresse: [Pending - ring kunde]
- Service: Moving clean (3 timer)
- Nøglekode: -

⚠️ ADVARSEL: Jørn booking har "TIL AFKLARING" - husk at ringe!

Time: 5 seconds Savings: 4 minutes

docs.title: Scenario: Find Available Time Slot
docs.text:
You: "Hvornår kan jeg passe Kunde XYZ ind i morgen? De vil have 3 timer"

AI:
[Checking calendar for tomorrow...]
[RenOS bookings: 08:00-10:00 optaget, 14:00-16:00 optaget]

📅 Ledige slots i morgen (16/1):
1. 10:30-13:30 ✅ (3 timer - perfekt)
2. 16:30-19:30 ⚠️ (sent på dagen)

Anbefaling: Book 10:30-13:30
Skal jeg oprette booking?

docs.title: Scenario: Resolve Booking Conflict
docs.text:
You: "Check om der er konflikter i næste uge"

AI:
⚠️ KONFLIKTER FUNDET:

Tirsdag 21/1:
- 14:00-16:00: Magney (2 timer basic)
- 14:30-16:30: Mathias (2 timer deep)
→ 30 min overlap!

Forslag:
1. Flyt Mathias til 17:00-19:00 ✅
2. Flyt Magney til 11:00-13:00 ✅
3. Kontakt en af kunderne

Skal jeg sende besked til Mathias om flytning?

docs.title: Scenario: Fix TypeScript Error
docs.text:
Current workflow: 1. Read error message (30 sek) 2. Search Stack Overflow (5 min) 3. Try fix (2 min) 4. Test (1 min) 5. Repeat if failed (10+ min) Total: 15-30 minutes

With AI Assistant:

You: "Fix denne fejl:
BookingCalendar.tsx:69 - ERROR: Missing ')' in expression"

AI (Qwen2.5-Coder):
[Analyzing error...]
[Checking BookingCalendar.tsx around line 69...]

🔍 Problem fundet:

Linje 69:
```typescript
const handleEvent = (event => {  // ❌ Missing closing parenthesis

Skal være: 

const handleEvent = (event) => {  // ✅ Fixed

💡 Bonus check: Fandt også 2 lignende issues: - Linje 145: Samme pattern - Linje 203: Manglende type annotation

Skal jeg fixe alle 3? 

**Time: 30 seconds**  
**Savings: 15-30 minutes**

---

### Scenario: Generate Boilerplate Code
You: "Lav en Prisma migration til bookings table med: - customer_id (relation) - service_type (enum: BASIC, DEEP, MOVEOUT) - start_time (datetime) - duration_hours (int, min 2) - status (enum: PENDING, CONFIRMED, COMPLETED) - access_code (optional string)"

AI: 

model Booking {
  id            String   @id @default(cuid())
  customerId    String
  serviceType   ServiceType
  startTime     DateTime
  durationHours Int      @default(2)
  status        BookingStatus @default(PENDING)
  accessCode    String?
  createdAt     DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt     DateTime @updatedAt

  customer Customer @relation(fields: [customerId], references: [id])

  @@index([customerId])
  @@index([startTime])
}

enum ServiceType {
  BASIC
  DEEP
  MOVEOUT
}

enum BookingStatus {
  PENDING
  CONFIRMED
  COMPLETED
  CANCELLED
}

✅ Migration klar. Kør: 

npx prisma migrate dev --name add_bookings

**Time: 45 seconds**  
**Savings: 10-15 minutes**

---

## 📧 Customer Follow-up

### Scenario: Check Overdue Invoices
You: "Hvilke kunder har ubetalte fakturaer?"

AI: [Checking Billy.dk...]

💰 UBETALTE FAKTURAER (4.314 DKK):

  1. Peder Kjær - 1.222 DKK
  2. Faktura: INV-2025-018
  3. Forfalden: 20/9/2024 (117 dage!)

  4. Sidste kontakt: 15/8/2024

  5. Casper Thygesen - 1.396 DKK

  6. Faktura: INV-2025-031
  7. Forfalden: 15/9/2024 (122 dage!)

  8. Sidste kontakt: Ingen registreret

  9. Lasse Hansen - 1.696 DKK

  10. Faktura: INV-2025-045
  11. Forfalden: 1/10/2024 (106 dage!)
  12. Sidste kontakt: 20/9/2024 (rykkerbrev sendt)

🎯 ANBEFALINGER: - Peder: Send 2. rykker + rykkergebyr - Casper: Ring direkte (ingen email respons) - Lasse: Overvej inkasso

Skal jeg sende rykkere til Peder og Lasse? 

---

### Scenario: Lead Follow-up
You: "Hvilke leads har jeg ikke fulgt op på?"

AI: [Checking RenOS CRM...]

🔴 KRITISKE LEADS (ingen opfølgning):

  1. Joel Kjellander
  2. Tilbud sendt: 27/8/2024
  3. Dage siden: 141 dage ❌
  4. Status: Intet svar

  5. Værdi: ~2.500 DKK (deep clean 150m²)

  6. Katrine Werge

  7. Tilbud sendt: 28/8/2024
  8. Dage siden: 140 dage ❌
  9. Status: "Vender tilbage"

  10. Værdi: ~1.800 DKK (basic clean)

  11. Helle Olesen

  12. Note: "Ring tirsdag kl 10"
  13. I DAG ⚠️
  14. Værdi: ~3.000 DKK (moving clean)

💡 FORSLAG: - Joel: Send "Stadig interesseret?" email - Katrine: Ring op direkte - Helle: RING NU! (det er tirsdag)

Skal jeg sende emails til Joel og Katrine? 

---

## 🌅 Morning Routine

### Complete Morning Briefing
You: "Good morning - giv mig dagens briefing"

AI: ☀️ GOD MORGEN, JONAS! - Onsdag 15. januar 2025

📅 I DAG (3 bookings): • 08:00-10:00: Mette Nielsen (Sødalvej 4, kode: 1234) • 10:30-12:00: Jørn Haagensen (Sølykken 16, kode: 1745) ⚠️ TIL AFKLARING • 14:00-16:00: Eoin Moving (adresse mangler - RING KUNDE)

💰 FAKTURAER: • 3 fakturaer fra i går skal oprettes: - Maria (2 timer) - Michael Roach (4 timer) - Eoin (2 timer) • Total: 2.790 DKK

🔴 KRITISK: • Helle Olesen: RING I DAG KL 10 (tilbud follow-up) • Jørn: Afklar ekstra rum før du møder op kl 10:30

⚠️ ADVARSLER: • Booking konflikt 21/1: Magney + Mathias overlap • 3 ubetalte fakturaer (4.314 DKK) - send rykkere?

📊 SYSTEM: • Chrome: 8.2 GB RAM (OK) • Ollama: Running, GPU 12% idle • Disk space: 127 GB free

🎯 TOP 3 PRIORITETER: 1. Ring til Helle kl 10:00 2. Opret 3 fakturaer fra i går 3. Afklar Jørn booking før 10:30

Klar til at starte dagen? 🚀 

**Replaces:**
- 10 min manual calendar check
- 5 min Billy.dk check
- 5 min RenOS review
- 5 min email/notes review

**Total savings: 25 minutes every morning**

---

## 🎯 Pro Tips

### Use Natural Language
✅ "Opret faktura til Michael, 4 timer i går" ✅ "Hvad har jeg i morgen efter kl 14?" ✅ "Send rykker til Peder"

❌ "CREATE_INVOICE customer_id=c123 hours=4" ❌ "SELECT * FROM bookings WHERE date=tomorrow" 

### Be Specific When Needed
Better: "Opret faktura til Michael Roach (Aarhus), ikke Michael Jensen" Better: "Book basic clean, ikke deep clean" Better: "Flyt booking til tirsdag 21/1 kl 14:00 præcis" 
### Ask for Explanations
"Hvorfor anbefaler du at flytte Mathias?" "Hvad er forskellen på basic og deep clean i systemet?" "Hvordan beregnes tilkørsel?" 
### Chain Commands
"Opret fakturaer fra i går, send rykkere til Peder og Lasse, og check om der er konflikter i næste uge"

AI vil: 1. Create invoices 2. Send reminders 3. Check conflicts 4. Report all results ```

docs.title: GET /billy/customers
docs.text:
Description: List all customers from Billy.dk

Request: 

GET /billy/customers?search=Michael

Query Parameters: | Parameter | Type | Required | Description | |-----------|------|----------|-------------| | search | string | No | Filter customers by name | | limit | number | No | Max results (default: 100) | | offset | number | No | Pagination offset |

Response: 

{
  "customers": [
    {
      "id": "c123",
      "name": "Michael Roach",
      "email": "michael@example.com",
      "phone": "+45 12 34 56 78",
      "address": "Sødalvej 4, 8000 Aarhus C",
      "createdAt": "2024-01-15T10:00:00Z"
    }
  ],
  "total": 1,
  "hasMore": false
}

Example (PowerShell): 

curl "https://tekup-billy.onrender.com/billy/customers?search=Michael"

docs.title: POST /billy/invoices
docs.text:
Description: Create new invoice in Billy.dk

Request: 

POST /billy/invoices
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "customer_id": "c123",
  "hours": 4,
  "service_type": "moving_clean",
  "description": "Flytterengøring",
  "date": "2025-01-14"
}

Request Body: | Field | Type | Required | Description | |-------|------|----------|-------------| | customer_id | string | Yes | Billy.dk customer ID | | hours | number | Yes | Number of hours worked | | service_type | string | No | "basic", "deep", "moving_clean" | | description | string | No | Custom description | | date | string | No | Invoice date (ISO 8601, default: today) |

Response: 

{
  "success": true,
  "invoice": {
    "id": "INV-2025-042",
    "customer": "Michael Roach",
    "amount": 1396,
    "currency": "DKK",
    "date": "2025-01-14",
    "dueDate": "2025-02-13",
    "status": "sent",
    "url": "https://billy.dk/invoices/INV-2025-042"
  }
}

Error Response: 

{
  "success": false,
  "error": "Customer not found",
  "code": "CUSTOMER_NOT_FOUND"
}

Example (PowerShell): 

$body = @{
    customer_id = "c123"
    hours = 4
    service_type = "moving_clean"
} | ConvertTo-Json

curl -X POST "https://tekup-billy.onrender.com/billy/invoices" `
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" `
     -d $body

docs.title: Standard Rates (2025)
docs.text: Service Type Rate (DKK/hour) VAT Total Basic Clean 299 25% 374 Deep Clean 349 25% 436 Moving Clean 349 25% 436

docs.title: Calculation Example
docs.text:
Scenario: 4 hours moving clean 

Base: 4 × 349 DKK = 1.396 DKK
VAT (25%): 1.396 × 0.25 = 349 DKK
Total: 1.745 DKK

Note: Billy.dk handles VAT calculation automatically

docs.title: 💰 Example: Create Invoice via AI
docs.text: Complete walkthrough of creating an invoice using TekUp AI Assistant.

docs.title: 📋 Scenario
docs.text:
Situation: You just completed a 4-hour moving clean for Michael Roach yesterday. You need to create and send an invoice.

Current manual process: 1. Open Billy.dk in browser 2. Click "New Invoice" 3. Find customer in dropdown 4. Add line item: "Flytterengøring - 4 timer" 5. Calculate: 4 × 349 DKK = 1.396 DKK 6. Save and send Time: 6-8 minutes

docs.title: Step 1: Open Jan AI
docs.text: Launch Jan AI from Start Menu or desktop shortcut.

docs.title: Step 2: Natural Language Command
docs.text:
Type in chat: 

Opret faktura til Michael Roach for 4 timer moving clean fra i går

docs.title: Step 3: AI Processing
docs.text:
What happens behind the scenes:

sequenceDiagram
    participant You
    participant Jan AI
    participant Ollama
    participant Billy MCP
    participant Tekup-Billy
    participant Billy.dk

    You->>Jan AI: "Opret faktura til Michael Roach, 4 timer..."
    Jan AI->>Ollama: Parse intent
    Ollama->>Jan AI: {customer: "Michael Roach", hours: 4, service: "moving_clean"}

    Jan AI->>Billy MCP: list_customers(search: "Michael Roach")
    Billy MCP->>Tekup-Billy: GET /billy/customers?search=Michael+Roach
    Tekup-Billy->>Billy.dk: API call
    Billy.dk->>Tekup-Billy: Customer data
    Tekup-Billy->>Billy MCP: {id: "c123", name: "Michael Roach"}
    Billy MCP->>Jan AI: Customer found ✓

    Jan AI->>Billy MCP: create_invoice({customer_id: "c123", hours: 4})
    Billy MCP->>Tekup-Billy: POST /billy/invoices
    Tekup-Billy->>Billy.dk: Create invoice
    Billy.dk->>Tekup-Billy: Invoice created
    Tekup-Billy->>Billy MCP: {invoice_id: "INV-2025-042", amount: 1396}
    Billy MCP->>Jan AI: Success ✓

    Jan AI->>Ollama: Format Danish response
    Ollama->>Jan AI: Response text
    Jan AI->>You: Display result

docs.title: Step 4: AI Response
docs.text:
You'll see:

🔍 Søger efter kunde: Michael Roach...
✓ Fundet: Michael Roach (kunde ID: c123)

💰 Opretter faktura:
- Service: Flytterengøring
- Timer: 4
- Pris pr. time: 349 DKK
- Subtotal: 1.396 DKK
- Moms (25%): 349 DKK
- Total: 1.745 DKK

📨 Sender faktura til Billy.dk...

✅ FAKTURA OPRETTET!

Faktura: INV-2025-042
Kunde: Michael Roach
Beløb: 1.745 DKK (inkl. moms)
Forfaldsdag: 13. februar 2025
Status: Sendt til kunde via email

Faktura link: https://billy.dk/invoices/INV-2025-042

Noget andet jeg kan hjælpe med? 🙂

Time: 15-20 seconds Time saved: ~7 minutes

docs.title: Error 1: Customer Not Found
docs.text:
Command: 

Opret faktura til Unknown Person, 3 timer

AI Response: 

❌ Kunde ikke fundet: "Unknown Person"

Fandt ingen match i Billy.dk.

Vil du:
1. Søge efter lignende navne?
2. Oprette ny kunde først?
3. Tjekke stavning?

Solution: Correct the name or create customer first

docs.title: Error 2: Missing Information
docs.text:
Command: 

Opret faktura til Michael Roach

AI Response: 

⚠️ Manglende information:
- Antal timer?
- Service type? (basic/deep/moving)

Eksempel:
"Opret faktura til Michael Roach for 4 timer moving clean"

Solution: Provide missing details

docs.title: Error 3: Billy.dk API Error
docs.text:
Command: 

Opret faktura til Michael Roach, 4 timer

AI Response: 

❌ Fejl fra Billy.dk API:
"Rate limit exceeded - too many requests"

Prøver igen om 30 sekunder...

[After retry]
✅ Faktura oprettet (forsøg 2/3)

Solution: AI retries automatically (up to 3 attempts)

docs.title: Manual Process (Average)
docs.text: Step Time Open Billy.dk 30s Find customer 30s Create invoice form 30s Add line items 2-3 min Calculate total 30s Review and send 1 min Total 6-8 min

docs.title: AI Process (Average)
docs.text:
Step Time Type command 5s AI processing 10-15s Total 15-20s

Time saved: ~7 minutes per invoice

docs.title: ✅ Verification Checklist
docs.text:
After invoice creation, verify:

  • [ ] Correct customer: Check name and email
  • [ ] Correct amount: Verify calculation
  • [ ] Correct date: Invoice date is correct
  • [ ] Service description: Matches work performed
  • [ ] Status: Invoice shows "Sent" in Billy.dk
  • [ ] Customer received: Check email was sent

First 50 invoices: Manual verification recommended After 50: Spot checks (every 10th invoice)

docs.title: Tip 1: Be Specific with Dates
docs.text:
✅ "faktura fra i går"
✅ "faktura for job d. 14/1"
✅ "faktura for sidste onsdag"

❌ "faktura for et job for nylig"

docs.title: Tip 2: Use Customer Identifiers
docs.text:
✅ "Michael Roach i Aarhus"
✅ "kunde #c123"
✅ "Michael med email michael@example.com"

docs.title: Tip 3: Chain Commands
docs.text:
"Opret fakturaer fra i går og vis mig totalen"

AI will:
1. Create invoices
2. Calculate sum
3. Show summary

docs.title: Tip 4: Ask for Confirmation (Optional)
docs.text:
"Lav faktura til Michael, 4 timer - men vis mig den først"

AI will:
- Show preview
- Ask for confirmation
- Create only if you approve

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Integrer Billy.dk directly in Open WebUI for invoice creation via chat.

Scenario: 

You: "Create invoice for Michael Roach - 4 hours moving clean"
AI: ✅ Invoice created successfully (Invoice #2024-0156)

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text:
Open WebUI (Browser)
       ↓
       ├─→ Ollama (Local AI Models)
       │   - Qwen, Llama, Mistral
       │
       └─→ Billy.dk Integration
           - REST API calls
           - Invoice creation
           - Customer lookup
           - Status tracking

docs.title: Integration Methods
docs.text:
We'll use Open WebUI's Web Scraper integration which is already available via MCP:

  1. Method A: Direct API calls from chat prompts
  2. Method B: OpenAI-compatible endpoints (if available)
  3. Method C: Webhooks/External integrations

docs.title: Step 2: Configure API Endpoint in Open WebUI
docs.text:
Since Open WebUI doesn't have built-in Billy.dk support, we'll use a workaround:

Option A: Use Web Functions in Prompt (Simplest)

Simply include in your Open WebUI chat:

Create an invoice using this API:

API Endpoint: https://tekup-billy.onrender.com/billy/invoices
Method: POST
Headers: Content-Type: application/json

Customer: Michael Roach
Hours: 4
Service: moving_clean
Description: Flytterengøring

Make the API call and report the result.

The AI will: 1. Understand your request 2. Format the API call correctly 3. Provide you the curl command 4. Explain what to run

Option B: Custom Python Script Integration

Create a Python script that Open WebUI can call:

docs.title: Step 3: Create Billy Integration Script
docs.text:
Create file: scripts/billy-integration.py

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Billy.dk Integration Script for TekUp AI Assistant
Handles invoice creation and customer lookups
"""

import requests
import json
import sys
from typing import Dict, Any

BILLY_BASE_URL = "https://tekup-billy.onrender.com"
BILLY_API_KEY = os.getenv("BILLY_API_KEY", "")

class BillyIntegration:
    def __init__(self):
        self.base_url = BILLY_BASE_URL
        self.headers = {
            "Content-Type": "application/json",
            "Authorization": f"Bearer {BILLY_API_KEY}" if BILLY_API_KEY else ""
        }

    def search_customers(self, query: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Search for customers by name"""
        try:
            url = f"{self.base_url}/billy/customers?search={query}"
            response = requests.get(url, headers=self.headers, timeout=10)
            response.raise_for_status()
            return response.json()
        except Exception as e:
            return {"error": str(e)}

    def create_invoice(self, customer_id: str, hours: float, 
                      service_type: str, description: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Create new invoice"""
        try:
            payload = {
                "customer_id": customer_id,
                "hours": hours,
                "service_type": service_type,
                "description": description,
                "date": datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
            }

            url = f"{self.base_url}/billy/invoices"
            response = requests.post(url, json=payload, headers=self.headers, timeout=10)
            response.raise_for_status()
            return response.json()
        except Exception as e:
            return {"error": str(e)}

    def get_invoice(self, invoice_id: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get invoice details"""
        try:
            url = f"{self.base_url}/billy/invoices/{invoice_id}"
            response = requests.get(url, headers=self.headers, timeout=10)
            response.raise_for_status()
            return response.json()
        except Exception as e:
            return {"error": str(e)}


def main():
    """CLI interface for Billy integration"""
    if len(sys.argv) < 2:
        print(json.dumps({"error": "Command required: search_customers, create_invoice, get_invoice"}))
        sys.exit(1)

    billy = BillyIntegration()
    command = sys.argv[1]

    if command == "search_customers":
        query = sys.argv[2] if len(sys.argv) > 2 else ""
        result = billy.search_customers(query)
        print(json.dumps(result))

    elif command == "create_invoice":
        # Create invoice: python script create_invoice <customer_id> <hours> <service_type> <description>
        customer_id = sys.argv[2]
        hours = float(sys.argv[3])
        service_type = sys.argv[4]
        description = " ".join(sys.argv[5:]) if len(sys.argv) > 5 else ""
        result = billy.create_invoice(customer_id, hours, service_type, description)
        print(json.dumps(result))

    elif command == "get_invoice":
        invoice_id = sys.argv[2]
        result = billy.get_invoice(invoice_id)
        print(json.dumps(result))

    else:
        print(json.dumps({"error": f"Unknown command: {command}"}))
        sys.exit(1)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

docs.title: CLI Control Guide - TekUp AI Assistant
Overview
docs.text: All TekUp AI components can be controlled directly from the command line, allowing you to: - Start/stop/monitor services from PowerShell or terminal - View logs and status in real-time - Integrate with your IDE and development workflow - Automate routine tasks

docs.title: Stack Components
docs.text: Component Port Command Purpose Ollama 11434 ollama serve Local AI model server Open WebUI 3000 docker start open-webui Web chat interface Docker - docker Container management

docs.title: 1. Start Ollama Server
docs.text:
# Windows (PowerShell)
ollama serve

# Or use Windows terminal with Ollama auto-start

Expected output: 

Listening on 127.0.0.1:11434

docs.title: 2. Start Open WebUI Container
docs.text:
./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action start

Expected output: 

════════════════════════════════════════
  Starting Docker Container: open-webui
════════════════════════════════════════
✓ Container started successfully

docs.title: 3. Open Web Interface
docs.text: Visit: http://localhost:3000

docs.title: Monitor Entire Stack
docs.text:
./scripts/monitor-stack.ps1

Shows status of: - Ollama server - Open WebUI web interface - Docker container

docs.title: Start Container
docs.text: ./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action start

docs.title: Stop Container
docs.text: ./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action stop

docs.title: View Container Status
docs.text: ./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action status

docs.title: View Container Logs
docs.text:
./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action logs

Last 50 lines of container output.

docs.title: Check Health Status
docs.text:
./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action health

Returns: starting, healthy, or unhealthy

docs.title: Remove Container
docs.text:
./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action remove

Warning: This deletes the container (data is preserved in volumes)

docs.title: Alternative: Docker Compose
docs.text: You can also use docker-compose for centralized management:

docs.title: Start with docker-compose
docs.text: docker-compose -f configs/open-webui/docker-compose.yml up -d

docs.title: Stop with docker-compose
docs.text: docker-compose -f configs/open-webui/docker-compose.yml down

docs.title: View logs
docs.text: docker-compose -f configs/open-webui/docker-compose.yml logs -f

docs.title: Direct Docker Commands
docs.text: If you prefer raw Docker commands:

docs.title: Start container
docs.text: docker start open-webui

docs.title: Stop container
docs.text: docker stop open-webui

docs.title: View running containers
docs.text: docker ps

docs.title: View all containers (including stopped)
docs.text: docker ps -a

docs.title: View container logs
docs.text: docker logs open-webui

docs.title: Follow logs in real-time
docs.text: docker logs -f open-webui

docs.title: View container resource usage
docs.text: docker stats open-webui

1. Check Docker status: 

    ./scripts/monitor-stack.ps1

  2. View logs:

docs.title: Port 3000 already in use
docs.text:
# Find process using port 3000
Get-Process -Id (Get-NetTCPConnection -LocalPort 3000).OwningProcess

# Stop the process or use a different port
# Update docker-compose.yml to use different port (e.g., 3001)

docs.title: Container unhealthy
docs.text:
Wait a few moments, then check: 

./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action health

If it persists: 

./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action logs

docs.title: Visual Studio Code
docs.text:
Create .vscode/tasks.json: 

{
  "version": "2.0.0",
  "tasks": [
    {
      "label": "Start TekUp Stack",
      "type": "shell",
      "command": "powershell",
      "args": ["-Command", "./scripts/monitor-stack.ps1"],
      "group": {
        "kind": "build",
        "isDefault": true
      }
    },
    {
      "label": "Monitor Stack",
      "type": "shell",
      "command": "powershell",
      "args": ["-Command", "./scripts/monitor-stack.ps1; Read-Host 'Press Enter to continue'"],
      "group": "build"
    }
  ]
}

Then use: Ctrl+Shift+B to run tasks

docs.title: PowerShell Alias
docs.text:
Add to your PowerShell profile: 

# In $PROFILE file
Set-Alias -Name tekup-start -Value "C:\path\to\tekup-ai-assistant\scripts\manage-docker.ps1"
Set-Alias -Name tekup-monitor -Value "C:\path\to\tekup-ai-assistant\scripts\monitor-stack.ps1"

Then use: 

tekup-start -Action start
tekup-monitor

docs.title: Docker Troubleshooting Guide - TekUp AI Assistant
Symptoms:
docs.text:
docker: error during connect: Head "http://%2F%2F.%2Fpipe%2FdockerDesktopLinuxEngine/_ping": 
open //./pipe/dockerDesktopLinuxEngine: The system cannot find the file specified.

docs.title: Option A: Start Docker Desktop
docs.text:
# Open Docker Desktop application
Start-Process "C:\Program Files\Docker\Docker\Docker Desktop.exe"

# Wait for daemon to start
Start-Sleep -Seconds 15

# Verify it's running
docker ps

docs.title: Option B: Check if already running
docs.text:
# Check running processes
tasklist | findstr docker

# Should show: Docker.exe, DockerD.exe

docs.title: Option C: Restart Docker Service
docs.text:
# Stop Docker
taskkill /F /IM docker.exe
taskkill /F /IM dockerd.exe

# Wait a moment
Start-Sleep -Seconds 5

# Start again
Start-Process "C:\Program Files\Docker\Docker\Docker Desktop.exe"
Start-Sleep -Seconds 20

docs.title: Prevention:
docs.text: Add Docker Desktop to Windows startup: 1. Open Settings 2. Apps → Startup 3. Toggle Docker Desktop ON

docs.title: Symptoms:
docs.text:
Error response from daemon: Ports are not available: exposing port TCP 0.0.0.0:3000 -> 0.0.0.0:0: 
listen tcp 0.0.0.0:3000: bind: An attempt was made to use a port in an illegal way.

docs.title: Find Process Using Port
docs.text:
# Find what's using port 3000
Get-NetTCPConnection -LocalPort 3000 -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | 
  Select-Object OwningProcess, State | 
  ForEach-Object { Get-Process -Id $_.OwningProcess }

docs.title: Option A: Kill the Process
docs.text:
# Find PID
$pid = (Get-NetTCPConnection -LocalPort 3000).OwningProcess

# Kill it
taskkill /PID $pid /F

docs.title: Option B: Use Different Port
docs.text:
Edit configs/open-webui/docker-compose.yml: 

services:
  open-webui:
    ports:
      - "3001:8080"  # Changed from 3000:8080

Then start: 

docker-compose -f configs/open-webui/docker-compose.yml up -d

Access on: http://localhost:3001

docs.title: Option C: Restart Everything
docs.text:
# Stop all containers
docker stop $(docker ps -q)

# Wait a moment
Start-Sleep -Seconds 5

# Start Open WebUI
./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action start

docs.title: Symptoms:
docs.text:
• Container exits immediately
  • Status shows "unhealthy"
  • Log shows errors

docs.title: Debug Steps:
docs.text:
# Check container status
docker ps -a | findstr open-webui

# View logs
./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action logs

# Or raw Docker logs
docker logs open-webui --tail 50

# Watch real-time logs
docker logs -f open-webui

docs.title: Memory Issues
docs.text:
Out of memory
Process exited with status code 1

Solution: Increase Docker memory allocation 1. Docker Desktop → Settings → Resources 2. Set Memory to 8GB or higher

docs.title: Permission Denied
docs.text:
Permission denied while trying to connect to Docker daemon

Solution: 

# Run PowerShell as Administrator
# Then retry command

docs.title: Image Not Found
docs.text:
docker: Error response from daemon: manifest not found

Solution: Pull image again 

docker pull ghcr.io/open-webui/open-webui:latest

# Then start
./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action start

docs.title: Symptoms:
docs.text: Status: Up 2 minutes (unhealthy)

docs.title: Debug:
docs.text:
# Check health status
docker inspect open-webui --format='{{.State.Health.Status}}'

# Should be: starting, healthy, or unhealthy

docs.title: Wait for Startup
docs.text:
Container typically takes 20-30 seconds to be healthy: 

# Wait then check
Start-Sleep -Seconds 30
./scripts/monitor-stack.ps1

docs.title: Restart Container
docs.text:
./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action stop
Start-Sleep -Seconds 5
./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action start
Start-Sleep -Seconds 30
./scripts/monitor-stack.ps1

docs.title: Check Dependencies
docs.text:
# Verify Ollama is running
./scripts/monitor-stack.ps1

# Ollama must be running for Open WebUI health check to pass

docs.title: Symptoms:
docs.text:
• Browser shows "Connection refused"
  • "Unable to reach server"

docs.title: Debug:
docs.text:
# 1. Check container is running
docker ps | findstr open-webui

# 2. Check port mapping
netstat -an | findstr 3000

# Should show: LISTENING on 0.0.0.0:3000

# 3. Check health
./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action health

# 4. Try curl
curl http://localhost:3000

# 5. View logs
./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action logs

docs.title: Restart Container
docs.text:
./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action stop
Start-Sleep -Seconds 5
./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action start
Start-Sleep -Seconds 15

# Try again
Start-Process "http://localhost:3000"

docs.title: Check Firewall
docs.text:
Windows Firewall might block localhost access:

  1. Settings → Windows Security → Firewall & network protection
  2. Allow an app through firewall
  3. Find Docker Desktop
  4. Check "Private" and "Public"

docs.title: Try Different Port
docs.text:
# Edit docker-compose.yml
# Change port from 3000 to 3001

docker-compose -f configs/open-webui/docker-compose.yml down
docker-compose -f configs/open-webui/docker-compose.yml up -d

# Visit http://localhost:3001

docs.title: Symptoms:
docs.text:
• Open WebUI shows "Cannot connect to Ollama"
  • Models list is empty
  • Connection error in logs

docs.title: Debug:
docs.text:
# 1. Check Ollama is running
ollama list

# 2. Check Ollama API
curl http://localhost:11434/api/tags

# 3. Inside container, can it reach host?
docker exec -it open-webui curl http://host.docker.internal:11434/api/tags

docs.title: Start Ollama if Stopped
docs.text: ollama serve

docs.title: Verify Connection String
docs.text: In Open WebUI Settings → Models: - Must be: http://host.docker.internal:11434 (for Docker on Windows) - NOT: http://localhost:11434 (that's the container's localhost)

docs.title: Firewall Block
docs.text:
# Allow Ollama through firewall
netsh advfirewall firewall add rule name="Ollama" dir=in action=allow program="C:\Users\empir\AppData\Local\Programs\Ollama\ollama.exe" enable=yes

docs.title: DNS/Network Issue
docs.text:
# Test connectivity from container
docker exec -it open-webui ping host.docker.internal

# Should show responses

docs.title: 7. Models Not Loading in Open WebUI
Symptoms:
docs.text:
• Connected to Ollama but models list is empty
  • Model selector shows nothing
  • Error loading models

docs.title: Debug:
docs.text:
# 1. Check models exist in Ollama
ollama list

# 2. Check API returns models
curl http://localhost:11434/api/tags | ConvertFrom-Json

# 3. Check Open WebUI logs
./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action logs | findstr -i model

# 4. Test from container
docker exec -it open-webui curl http://host.docker.internal:11434/api/tags

docs.title: Download Missing Models
docs.text:
# If Ollama list shows empty, download models
ollama pull qwen2.5-coder:14b-instruct-q4_K_M
ollama pull llama3.3:8b-instruct-q5_K_M
ollama pull mistral:7b-instruct-q4_K_M

# Verify
ollama list

docs.title: Reconnect in Open WebUI
docs.text:
1. Open WebUI Settings → Models
  2. Test connection: Should show "✓ Connected"
  3. If not, remove connection and re-add:
  4. http://host.docker.internal:11434
  5. Refresh page (F5)
  6. Models should appear

docs.title: Check Model Compatibility
docs.text:
Not all quantized models work. If model doesn't load: 

# Download different quantization
ollama pull qwen2.5-coder:14b-instruct-q5_K_S

# Retry in Open WebUI

docs.title: Symptoms:
docs.text:
• Container keeps crashing
  • "Out of Memory" in logs
  • System becomes unresponsive

docs.title: Debug:
docs.text:
# Check container memory usage
docker stats open-webui --no-stream

# Check system memory
Get-CimInstance Win32_ComputerSystem | Select-Object TotalPhysicalMemory

# View logs
./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action logs | tail -20

docs.title: Limit Container Memory
docs.text:
Edit configs/open-webui/docker-compose.yml: 

services:
  open-webui:
    deploy:
      resources:
        limits:
          memory: 4G  # Limit to 4GB

Then restart: 

docker-compose -f configs/open-webui/docker-compose.yml restart

docs.title: Free System Memory
docs.text:
# Check what's using memory
Get-Process | Sort-Object WorkingSet -Descending | Select-Object Name, WorkingSet -First 10

# Close unnecessary applications

docs.title: Reduce Model Size
docs.text:
Use smaller quantization (faster download, less memory): 

# Instead of Q5, use Q4
ollama pull qwen2.5-coder:14b-instruct-q4_K_M

# Instead of 14B, use 7B
ollama pull mistral:7b-instruct-q4_K_M

docs.title: 9. Docker Takes Too Long to Start
Symptoms:
docs.text:
• docker ps hangs
  • Scripts timeout
  • "Waiting for Docker daemon..."

docs.title: Restart Docker Desktop
docs.text:
# Close Docker completely
taskkill /F /IM docker.exe
taskkill /F /IM dockerd.exe
taskkill /F /IM Docker Desktop.exe

# Wait
Start-Sleep -Seconds 10

# Start again
Start-Process "C:\Program Files\Docker\Docker\Docker Desktop.exe"

# Monitor startup
Start-Sleep -Seconds 20
docker ps

docs.title: Check Docker Desktop Logs
docs.text:
1. Docker Desktop → Settings
  2. Go to "General" section
  3. Check if there are startup errors

docs.title: Disable WSL2 Integration (if issues persist)
docs.text:
1. Docker Desktop → Settings → Resources
  2. Uncheck "Use the WSL 2 based engine"
  3. Restart

docs.title: Symptoms:
docs.text: open /var/run/docker.sock: permission denied

docs.title: Run as Administrator
docs.text:
# Right-click PowerShell → "Run as Administrator"
# Then run docker commands

docs.title: Add User to Docker Group (Linux only)
docs.text:
Not applicable on Windows, but if running WSL2: 

sudo usermod -aG docker $USER

docs.title: 11. Container Port Binding Fails on Restart
Symptoms:
docs.text: Error: port is already allocated

docs.title: Full Reset
docs.text:
# Stop everything
docker stop open-webui
docker rm open-webui

# Wait
Start-Sleep -Seconds 5

# Restart
./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action start

docs.title: Alternative Port
docs.text:
# Recreate with different port
docker rm open-webui
docker run -d -p 3001:8080 `
  --add-host=host.docker.internal:host-gateway `
  --name open-webui `
  ghcr.io/open-webui/open-webui:latest

docs.title: Symptoms:
docs.text:
• Can't pull Docker images
  • Can't access external APIs
  • Timeout errors

docs.title: Configure Docker Proxy
docs.text:
Edit Docker daemon config at: 

C:\Users\empir\AppData\Docker\daemon.json

Add: 

{
  "proxies": {
    "default": {
      "httpProxy": "http://proxy.company.com:8080",
      "httpsProxy": "https://proxy.company.com:8080",
      "noProxy": "localhost,127.0.0.1,host.docker.internal"
    }
  }
}

Restart Docker Desktop.

docs.title: Use VPN/Proxy Outside Network
docs.text: If at home/public network: - Most issues resolved automatically - Ensure firewall allows port 3000

docs.title: Quick Health Check
docs.text: ./scripts/monitor-stack.ps1

docs.title: Full System Status
docs.text:
# Docker status
docker ps -a

# Running containers with stats
docker stats

# Container details
docker inspect open-webui

# Network check
docker network ls

# Volume check
docker volume ls

docs.title: Logs Analysis
docs.text:
# Last 50 lines
docker logs open-webui --tail 50

# Real-time follow
docker logs -f open-webui

# Since specific time
docker logs --since 10m open-webui

docs.title: System Information
docs.text:
# Docker version
docker version

# Docker system info
docker system info

# Disk usage
docker system df

docs.title: Complete Reset
docs.text:
# 1. Stop everything
docker stop open-webui 2>$null
docker rm open-webui 2>$null

# 2. Restart Docker
taskkill /F /IM docker.exe 2>$null
Start-Sleep -Seconds 10

# 3. Restart Docker Desktop
Start-Process "C:\Program Files\Docker\Docker\Docker Desktop.exe"
Start-Sleep -Seconds 30

# 4. Verify Docker is working
docker ps

# 5. Run setup script
./scripts/setup-open-webui.ps1

docs.title: Docker Desktop Factory Reset
docs.text:
1. Docker Desktop → Settings → General
  2. Click "Reset" button
  3. Click "Reset Docker Desktop to factory defaults"
  4. Confirm
  5. Restart computer

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
If issues persist:

  1. Check logs: ./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action logs
  2. Check status: ./scripts/monitor-stack.ps1
  3. Try restart: ./scripts/manage-docker.ps1 -Action stop/start
  4. Check documentation: See CLI Control Guide
  5. Search: GitHub issues at https://github.com/open-webui/open-webui/issues

Last Updated: 2025-01-15 For: TekUp AI Assistant on Windows 11
